ote:

> Does anyone know of a NEAT or hyperNEAT plugin for the breve

ulation engine?  If not, I will write one, if someone points me

e most solid and lightweight c/c++ version.

I'm not sure how lightw=
eight you need for C++ implementations, but for
HyperNEAT, Jason Gauci's C+=
+ is probably the most tested.  It's
available from our software page:

htt=
p://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/software.html

However, I believe Jason is soon going =
to post a GUI-free version of
the program, which would be better for your p=
urposes.

For regular NEAT, as far as C++, my rtNEAT code is probably the m=
ost
used, though there may be others:

http://nn.cs.utexas.edu/soft-view.ph=
p?SoftID=3D88

ken
